userStories.title: Add position buttons next to categories
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see L | R | - buttons next to each category in the tree view so that I can quickly identify and change mega menu column positions.
acceptanceCriteria: Each category in the tree has a group of three buttons: L (left), R (right), - (not set)
Buttons are visible next to category name without interfering with drag & drop
Buttons have tooltips explaining their function (Left column, Right column, Not set)
Buttons are small enough not to dominate the interface

userStories.title: Visual highlighting of active position
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see which position is currently active for each category so that I can quickly scan the current mega menu configuration.
acceptanceCriteria: Active button is highlighted with color (e.g., blue/green background)
Inactive buttons have neutral style (gray/outline)
Button state reflects actual database value on page load
Categories without set value have the '-' button highlighted

userStories.title: Save position via AJAX
userStories.description: As a user, I want changes to be saved immediately when I click a position button so that I don't have to manually save after each change.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a button sends AJAX request to save the new value
Value is saved as term meta 'merida_mega_menu_column_position'
Available values: 'left', 'right', '' (empty string for not set)
AJAX request is secured with nonce
Only users with appropriate permissions can change values

userStories.title: Visual feedback during save
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see visual feedback when saving so that I know my change was successful.
acceptanceCriteria: During save, button shows loading state (spinner or opacity change)
After successful save, button changes to active state
On error, an error message is displayed (e.g., toast notification)
UI is blocked for the category during ongoing save (prevent double-click)

userStories.title: Integration with existing category view
userStories.description: As a user, I want the position controls to be seamlessly integrated into the existing category tree view so that the interface remains consistent and intuitive.
acceptanceCriteria: Buttons are added to existing category template in the tree
Styling is consistent with the rest of the plugin interface
Buttons do not affect drag & drop sorting functionality
View works correctly on different screen widths (responsiveness)
